metadata.Title: CVE-2022-40959 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
During iframe navigation, certain pages did not have their FeaturePolicyfully initialized leading to a bypass that leaked device permissions intountrusted subdocuments. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 102.3,Thunderbird < 102.3, and Firefox < 105.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-40959` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 105.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 105.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 105.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '105.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
